intro: Macrosolen elasticus, commonly known as the elastic fern, is a unique plant species characterized by its flexible, leaf-like structures that can bend and twist without breaking. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. The plant exhibits a distinctive morphology with elongated, ribbon-like fronds that can grow up to several meters in length. Its ability to stretch and return to its original shape is due to the specialized cell structure in its tissues. This adaptability makes it well-suited for climbing and thriving in humid, shaded environments.
